The Forest Landscape Restoration Act may be cited as the official title of this legislation. The purpose of the Act is outlined in section 2. The Forest Landscape Restoration Act aims to promote collaborative ecosystem restoration in priority forest areas by encouraging sustainability, leveraging local and national resources, reducing wildfire management costs, and demonstrating the effectiveness of ecological restoration techniques. The Forest Landscape Restoration Act promotes collaborative ecosystem restoration in priority forest areas to reduce wildfire risk, demonstrate ecological restoration techniques' effectiveness, and offset treatment costs with forest restoration byproducts. The Forest Landscape Restoration Act defines key terms such as "covered Federal lands," "Fund," "program," and "Secretaries" for the Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program. The Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program is established by the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture to fund ecological restoration treatments for priority forest landscapes.
